page.title: 06Entertainment (Gwyddelwern).
page.content: People in Gwyddelwern entertain themselves and each other. Friends meet for a chat in each others houses. {The local hostelry}is a meeting place where news is exchanged, troubles are discussed and a joke shared. The menfolk, and some women too, enjoy a game of darts or 'pool'. The Snooker table in the village hall is well used again mostly by the men. During the winter months there are{whist drives and{coffee evenings.} Some societies hold 'open' evenings to which everyone is invited. These include film shows, fashion shows, quizes, concerts by visiting choirs and groups, a conjuring show and a folk dance. The{Drama Society}gives a well attended performance and drama groups from other villages also come and perform. Mrs M. Johns.
